docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: DR. JULES OLDER remembers when his twin daughters, then 12 years old, pulled back from his daily ritual of embracing them as they went off to school. They said, in unison, ''There's no law that says we have to kiss you goodbye every day.'' Dr. Older, an assistant clinical professor of psychiatry at the University of Vermont College of Medicine in
